item.itunes:title: Django Co-Creator - Simon Willison (Ep 21 Replay)
item.itunes:author: William Vincent
item.itunes:summary: Simon Willison is a co-creator of Django and currently works at Eventbrite. We discuss the early days of Django, the founding of Lanyrd, and his ongoing work with Datasette to make it easier to publish and explore data online.
item.itunes:subtitle: Simon Willison is a co-creator of Django and currently works at Eventbrite. We discuss the early days of Django, the founding of Lanyrd, and his ongoing work with Datasette to make it easier to publish and explore data online.

item.itunes:title: 20 Years of Python - Brett Cannon
item.itunes:author: William Vincent
item.itunes:summary: Brett is a Python Core Contributor and leads the Python/VS Code team at Microsoft. We discuss his twenty years of open-source Python work, how to get involved today, the future of packaging, virtual environments, the standard library, VSCode, and more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Brett is a Python Core Contributor and leads the Python/VS Code team at Microsoft. We discuss his twenty years of open-source Python work, how to get involved today, the future of packaging, virtual environments, the standard library, VSCode, and more.

item.itunes:title: Sentry - David Cramer
item.itunes:author: William Vincent
item.itunes:summary: David is co-founder and CTO of Sentry, an open-source application monitoring and error tracking tool. We discuss building the early versions in Django, being self-taught, the advantages of middleware, next-generation hosting platforms, and general tips to avoid reinventing the wheel constantly in technology.
item.itunes:subtitle: David is co-founder and CTO of Sentry, an open-source application monitoring and error tracking tool. item.itunes:author: William Vincent
item.itunes:summary: David is an engineer at Read the Docs where he focuses on EthicalAds.io, a developer and privacy-focused ad network. We talk about internet advertising and why much of it is not ethical, the open source code powering the ad server, and what it takes to serve tens of millions of monthly API requests.

item.itunes:title: Search
item.itunes:author: William Vincent
item.itunes:summary:
Despite being a "batteries included" framework, Django provides no built-in support for search. And yet almost every website needs it!
We discuss how to add search to any Django site via filters and Q objects. Then move on to more advanced options including full text search with PostgreSQL, Elastic, and more.
item.itunes:subtitle:
Despite being a "batteries included" framework, Django provides no built-in support for search. And yet almost every website needs it!
We discuss how to add search to any Django site via filters and Q objects. Then move on to more advanced options including full text search with PostgreSQL, Elastic, and more.

item.itunes:title: Teaching Python - Nicholas Tollervey
item.itunes:author: William Vincent and Carlton Gibson
item.itunes:summary: Nicholas Tollervey has played a major role in how Python is taught to millions of students. A former music teacher turned software developer, he worked on the BBC micro:bit project that put a computing device in the hands of a million 11-12 year olds in the UK. He's also the creator of the Mu editor for Python beginners, CodeGrades, and many other projects.
item.itunes:subtitle: Nicholas Tollervey has played a major role in how Python is taught to millions of students.
